head.title: Homicide Charge in Parking Lot Dispute

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Homicide Charge in Parking Lot Dispute

abstract.p: Brian Faulkes is charged with killing midtown Manhattan parking lot manager, Methis Weingarten, who had tried to stop Faulkes from driving through lot (S)

block.p: A 27-year-old Bronx man was charged last night with killing a Midtown parking lot manager by punching him in the face during a dispute, the police said.

The police charged the man, Brian Faulkes, of 1252 West Farms Road, with criminally negligent homicide and said they had tracked him down through an outstanding parking violation. The police said Mr. Faulkes had driven into the Dynamic Parking lot on 42nd Street between Eighth and Ninth Avenues at 5 p.m. Monday and attempted to drive through it to 43rd Street.
A 27-year-old Bronx man was charged last night with killing a Midtown parking lot manager by punching him in the face during a dispute, the police said.

The police charged the man, Brian Faulkes, of 1252 West Farms Road, with criminally negligent homicide and said they had tracked him down through an outstanding parking violation. The police said Mr. Faulkes had driven into the Dynamic Parking lot on 42nd Street between Eighth and Ninth Avenues at 5 p.m. Monday and attempted to drive through it to 43rd Street.

After the manager, Methis Weingarten, 47, tried to stop him, Mr. Faulkes backed his car out of the lot, parked it, then came back and punched Mr. Weingarten in the face, causing him to collapse to the ground and crack his skull, the police said.
